documentType: last will and testament with codicil
summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated October 24, 2012, with a first codicil dated June 6, 2013. It appoints executors, directs the payment of debts and taxes, and bequeaths all his property to the trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2012 Trust. The codicil changes the designated successor executor.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will, dated October 24, 2012, bequeaths his entire estate to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2012 Trust'.
The primary executors appointed are Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley.
A first codicil, dated June 6, 2013, changes the named successor executor from Andrew Farkas to David J. Mitchell.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or trust.
The executors are granted extremely broad powers to manage, invest, and dispose of estate assets without needing court approval.
